author: sikaffy27
title: Decentralised Dating Application
description: オンライン・デートは社会に不可欠なものとなっていますが、中央集権的なデート・アプリでは、人々が適切な恋愛相手を見つけることができません。

f6_assessments.q0:
Using AI and blockchain to advance to a higher level of profile sharing for supporting dating is a great idea to help fix the problem of current online dating apps. 
But the team lack content to state that how their app will benefit Cardano ecosystem, and key metrics that help CA to better assess their goals, and is this idea aligned with what challenge guided, like: how many active users in this app, how many searches or social interaction monthly to channels of this app, how many matches will make...
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has shown the detail of their solution in both user cases and technology inside the platform, but lacking a roadmap can't help to know what they gonna do to complete their goals. Furthermore, lacking a roadmap can help to evaluate the required budget is good or not. Therefore, this proposal gets low feasibility. 
This is a complex project with the mixing of a lot of functional skills to succeed, including coding, event, communication... but the team show non of them in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
As I recommend in 2 previous comments, they should provide those infos. Including roadmap and key metrics, lacking these both can't help to audit. 
The good thing is that they have a well awareness about the problem context and state a good solution for solve it, their app and its features will help.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is great and the problem is what this challenge wants to solve. But the proposer doesn't have any content to show that this project will help the ecosystem, although there is a lot of info about value, market, and features... Moreover, they don't have key metrics. I think that the proposer doesn't have much concern to this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer only provides a detailed implementation plan with detailed use cases and features that can help us visualize what they want to do. But I think this project is complex and needs a big budget, well preparation than what has in this proposal. It has a big idea but the proposer needs to provide a clear and realistic roadmap to help us assess their project. Moreover, some team member info, and make the budget more reasonable with the plan and roadmap, give some risk-relevant that team will face off... is additional needs for successfully funded.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer provides nothing in this proposal to audit it. 
No plan, no roadmap, no key metrics in this proposal.
But the team has a good vision for their solution, that will solve the standing problem. Both are explained in detail in the proposal that help clarify to what they expect.

f6_assessments.q0: "I understand the idea would be to create a registry & blockchain engine that connects records that share a high degree of commonality and complementary attributes. According to the description of the functions and the project that will release the token, you will have a lot of work to do and I wonder to what extent the product will be complete after 3 months according to the requirements of the challenge. I think the proposal will be more suitable in the challenge ""Seeding Cardano's Grassroots DeFi"" because the project information describes in detail to AMM, Tokenomics and interests of the data holder, the dating participants and the product completion time. Products"
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal is written describing the solution, the plan is very detailed. The proposed cost is also clearly listed for each content, but it is recommended to add the number of participants and the implementation time. The proposed group identity should be provided to social networking sites. The only thing I wonder is is there any legal risk, with how people using different languages ​​will be connected, that requires credentials. The application only stops at finding the right person, it will be better to have the next results or evaluate the effectiveness of the project from insiders.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap for building VR/AR dating functions with goals to be achieved has been described in detail, some of the risks for token holders are mentioned. The time to complete the product according to the criteria of 3 months is still what I wonder about the project

solution: 補完的な属性や共通点を持つプロファイルをつなぐブロックチェーンのレジストリとエンジンを作成します。
experience:
マリオ・ムラレス - エコノミスト
Danish Hameed - フルスタックデベロッパー
Daniel Golman - javascript開発者
Steven clarke - ラスト開発者
